intro: Chamaesyce macgillivrayi, commonly known as the coastal sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming from spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, oval-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Chamaesyce macgillivrayi is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
